intro: Cnidium petroselinum, commonly known as wild chervil, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are usually arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. The plant is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils.
